overview: Jefffery Wolfe is co-founder, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board of Directors of groSolar. He is a recognized leader in the solar energy industry and a leading voice on solar energy policy throughout the U.S. Jeff is in charge of strategy, M&A, and PV procurement for the Company. Under his direction, groSolar has become the fourth largest residential installer in the U.S., the largest 100% U.S. owned distributor of solar equipment and systems, and a large commercial systems provider. Prior to forming groSolar, Jeff was a Partner in Bard, Rao + Athanas Consulting Engineers, where he started and ran branch offices in Hanover, NH and Chicago, IL. Jeff is the elected chair of the PV Division of the Solar Electric Industry Association (SEIA), the country’s leading PV trade organization. He also serves on the Union of Concerned Scientists National Advisory Board and is one of only 1,000 people in the U.S. trained in presenting Al Gore’s climate change presentation. Jeff has a BSME degree from Cornell University.
